ai.summary: Gortalughany is a gentle 5.1 km hike in the UK, suitable for beginners. The route follows well-marked paths through varied scenery with light elevation and steady, easy terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily well-maintained footpaths and grassy tracks with occasional gravel. Expect gentle gradients, some muddy stretches after rain, and intermittent woodland and open-field views.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast before you go; UK weather can change quickly. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip and bring waterproof clothing. Carry a map and/or GPS, and ensure your phone is charged. Bring sufficient water and snacks. Stay on marked paths, be mindful of muddy sections after rain, and watch for other walkers or cyclists on shared routes. Let someone know your plan and expected return time.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for the best dry conditions and clearer views; winter hikes can be wet, cold, and slippery.
